title: U.S. per capita consumption of fresh fruit by fruit type 2018
summary: This bar chart has 11 columns on the x axis representing Fruits, and Per capita consumption in pounds in each Fruits on the y axis.
Fruits Bananas has the highest Per capita consumption in pounds and Cherries has the lowest Per capita consumption in pounds.
The difference of Per capita consumption in pounds between the highest and lowest Fruits is 26.9.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Per capita consumption in pounds for 11 number of Fruitss.
The Per capita consumption in pounds is appeared to be the highest at Fruits Bananas and lowest at Fruits Cherries.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 11 columns on the x axis representing Fruits, and Per capita consumption in pounds in each Fruits on the y axis.
Fruits Bananas has the highest Per capita consumption in pounds and Cherries has the lowest Per capita consumption in pounds.
The difference of Per capita consumption in pounds between the highest and lowest Fruits is 26.9.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Per capita consumption in pounds for 11 number of Fruitss.
The Per capita consumption in pounds is appeared to be the highest at Fruits Bananas and lowest at Fruits Cherries.
The highest Fruits Bananas has 26.9 more Per capita consumption in pounds than the lowest Fruits Cherries.
Per capita consumption in pounds at Fruits Bananas is 28.2 , second place is Apples at 16.9, and thirdly is Oranges at 8.2.
The Fruits Cherries tends to be 3.27 percent lower than average.
The Per capita consumption in pounds is 94.9 if we add up values of all Fruitss.
